articles.headline: Michigan State’s $500 Million for Nassar Victims Dwarfs Other Settlements
articles.snippet: Officials agreed to a settlement that is believed to be the largest ever reached in a sex abuse case involving a U.S. university.
articles.abstract: Officials agreed to a settlement that is believed to be the largest ever reached in a sex abuse case involving a U.S. university.
articles.lead_paragraph: Victims of Lawrence G. Nassar, the Michigan State University physician who sexually abused young women under the guise of medical treatment, would receive $500 million from the university in a settlement that is believed to be the largest ever reached in a sexual abuse case involving an American university.
articles.byline: By Mitch Smith and Anemona Hartocollis

articles.headline: Code Name Crossfire Hurricane: The Secret Origins of the Trump Investigation
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump has described the investigation as a politically motivated effort to undermine his presidency. But time and again, agents took steps that ultimately benefited him.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump has described the investigation as a politically motivated effort to undermine his presidency. But time and again, agents took steps that ultimately benefited him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Within hours of opening an investigation into the Trump campaign’s ties to Russia in the summer of 2016, the F.B.I. dispatched a pair of agents to London on a mission so secretive that all but a handful of officials were kept in the dark.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo, Adam Goldman and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Trump Discloses Cohen Payment, Raising Questions About Previous Omission
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s financial disclosure included a payment made to his personal attorney, Michael D. Cohen, who has said he paid a porn star who claimed an affair with Mr. Trump.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s financial disclosure included a payment made to his personal attorney, Michael D. Cohen, who has said he paid a porn star who claimed an affair with Mr. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s financial disclosure, released on Wednesday, included for the first time repayment of more than $100,000 to his personal lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, in 2017, raising questions about whether Mr. Trump’s sworn filing from a year ago improperly omitted the debt.
articles.byline: By Steve Eder, Eric Lipton and Ben Protess

articles.headline: On Trade, the U.S. and China Consider the Unthinkable: Breaking Up
articles.snippet: Complete disengagement is impossible, but both Washington and Beijing envision a day when they don’t need each other as much to power their economies.
articles.abstract: Complete disengagement is impossible, but both Washington and Beijing envision a day when they don’t need each other as much to power their economies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The economic relationship between China and the United States has defined the modern era. It helped lift hundreds of millions of people in China out of poverty. It gave affordable iPhones and other gadgets to American consumers, handed big profits to American companies and delivered 1.3 billion hungry customers to American farmers.

articles.headline: The Entire Economy Is MoviePass Now. Enjoy It While You Can.
articles.snippet: Inspired by Silicon Valley’s hyper-growth, companies elsewhere are burning cash in hopes of being the next big thing.
articles.abstract: Inspired by Silicon Valley’s hyper-growth, companies elsewhere are burning cash in hopes of being the next big thing.
articles.lead_paragraph: I’ve got a great idea for a start-up. Want to hear the pitch?

articles.headline: In Rebuke of Trump, Tillerson Says Lies Are a Threat to Democracy
articles.snippet: The ex-secretary of state, who didn’t mention the president by name in a commencement speech at the Virginia Military Institute, said efforts to hide the truth amounted to going “wobbly on America.”
articles.abstract: The ex-secretary of state, who didn’t mention the president by name in a commencement speech at the Virginia Military Institute, said efforts to hide the truth amounted to going “wobbly on America.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a veiled rebuke of President Trump, former Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson warned on Wednesday that American democracy was threatened by a growing “crisis of ethics and integrity.”

articles.headline: CBS Tries to Sell Its TV Dramas as Its Own Battle Heats Up in Court
articles.snippet: Shari Redstone hopes to merge the network with Viacom. But the CBS head, Leslie Moonves, has other ideas. Now, a judge is working to settle the dispute.
articles.abstract: Shari Redstone hopes to merge the network with Viacom. But the CBS head, Leslie Moonves, has other ideas. Now, a judge is working to settle the dispute.
articles.lead_paragraph: When he took the stage at Carnegie Hall during CBS’s annual presentation to advertisers on Wednesday, Stephen Colbert did not shy away from the topic on the minds of everyone in the audience.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced, John Koblin and Sapna Maheshwari

articles.headline: A Battle for Control of CBS, With Far-Reaching Consequences
articles.snippet: No matter who wins in the fight over the proposed reunion of CBS and Viacom, both companies will be profoundly affected and the media landscape will be transformed.
articles.abstract: No matter who wins in the fight over the proposed reunion of CBS and Viacom, both companies will be profoundly affected and the media landscape will be transformed.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that the proposed reunion of CBS and Viacom hasn’t been a Hollywood romance. But simmering tensions erupted into open warfare this week, with far more at stake than control of two legendary entertainment companies.
